snippet: A fire chief in Westchester County whose firefighters disclosed that he had used anti-Semitic slurs to deride a town supervisor has decided to retire at the end of the year.
abstract: Anthony LoGiudice, chief of Fairview Fire District in Greenburgh, NY, says he will retire at end of 2014; announcement follows disclosures from several firefighters that they had heard LoGiudice use anti-Semitic slurs to refer to Greenburgh's town supervisor, Paul J Feiner.
lead_paragraph: A fire chief in Westchester County whose firefighters disclosed that he had used anti-Semitic slurs to deride a town supervisor has decided to retire at the end of the year.

headline.main: Amid Storm Over Slurs, Fire Chief Plans Exit
